intro: Pyrethrum heldreichianum, commonly known as the Balkan pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flower heads. The plant produces tiny, thread-like hairs called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, often growing in alpine or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in pest control, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
